movie_night.title: Blade Runner (Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?)

score.title: Setting in brief
paragraphs: Earth is a graveyard, humanity scattered in colonies across the solar system, struggling to survive in the aftermath of the TITAN holocaust. But even as humanity struggles to survive, advances in technology and the sciences redefine what it means to be human in the first place.

Death is no longer the end, merely an expensive inconvenience. The person you saw yesterday with blonde hair and green eyes may be sporting chrome and hosepipes tomorrow, and that pet monkey you had when you were a kid? It might just teach you graduate-level calculus.

relationships.title: Family?
elements: Two siblings, one who deleted his, or her, or its memories of the other
Niece or nephew and eccentric aunt or uncle who is still a flat
Independently wealthy man or woman who won’t pay to get his or her mother-in-law’s ego sleeved out of a virtual colony and his or her spouse

Servant before the Fall, master after (and vice-versa)
Pandora gate administration liaison and gate crasher

No longer married, and hating it

High-profile bioconservative and his or her former lover who is now in a synth morph

Creator of an Augmented Reality and the hacker who made it the laughingstock of the solar system

relationships.title: community
elements: Bureaucrat from the Autonomist Alliance and someone who has been set a punishment for antisocial behavior
Community leader and that one person who always speaks up in meetings—without doing any research
Methane sailing gold medalist from the previous Titan Olympics and the up-and-coming snot nose who’s trying to take it from him or her

needs.title: To get even...
elements: with the veteran/rookie gatecrasher who screwed up our last mission.
with the flat who keeps insulting uplifts’ intelligence.
with the stuffy academic/hired muscle gate crasher who won’t admit he/she/it is wrong when it comes to this particular mission.
with the bioconservative who sabotaged my synth morph.
with the college roommate who jacked/plagiarized my paper—straight from my Cortical Stack!

needs.title: To get respect...
elements: From the other experts in my field of work
From the other members of my gatecrashing team

needs.title: To get the truth...
elements: About those memories I accidentally deleted off of my Cortical Stack
About what really happened to Jed

needs.title: To get laid...
elements: Before this TITAN nanovirus kills me
Before the warranty on my new morph expires.
While my fork finishes up the work.
